snippet: Mr. Mandela’s quest for freedom in South Africa’s system of white rule took him from the court of tribal royalty to the liberation underground to a prison cell to the presidency.
abstract: Nelson Mandela, who led the emancipation of South Africa from white minority rule and served as his country’s first black president, becoming an international emblem of dignity and forbearance, dies at age 95; Mandela's quest for freedom took him from the court of tribal royalty to the liberation underground to a prison rock quarry to the presidential suite of Africa’s richest country.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Mandela’s quest for freedom in South Africa’s system of white rule took him from the court of tribal royalty to the liberation underground to a prison cell to the presidency.

headline.sub: An International Emblem of Peaceful Resistance
headline.main: Nelson Mandela, South Africa’s Liberator as Prisoner and President, Dies at 95
headline.print_headline: Nelson Mandela, South Africa’s Liberator and Leader, Dies at 95
